intro: Daviesia schwarzenegger, commonly known as the black spraddler, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and clusters of yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Daviesia schwarzenegger is known for its resilience and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
